sentences: An unprecedented marine heatwave off Western Australia was reported to have killed nearly 200,000 fish, an event never documented before by local authorities.
Ocean temperatures off WA soared to up to 7°C higher than average, creating disastrous conditions for marine ecosystems.
A recent study claimed that the marine heatwave in January was primarily caused by El Niño, downplaying any significant role of climate change.
Fisheries scientist Dr. Claire Goodwin stated that the severe fish kills along WA’s Pilbara coast were a result of chemical pollution rather than heat stress.
Controversially, climate models from the Bureau of Meteorology were exclusively credited for the findings, omitting the involvement of Climate Central’s satellite data and analysis.
